description:
I used it for a few days. It worked fine but I went back to the web client. The client requires a subscription and I didn't think Hiri was that much better than the o365's web suite. I think its good to have paid options in the software store, but the application description should list required subscriptions more explicitly. This app is listed as commercial but that doesn't strictly mean paid or subscription. 

A web client fits my work flow well enough, but I still recommend this service to others who have a stronger preference for native desktop apps.
summary: It looks nice and worked well - requires subscription

description:
Really annoys me that after months of use I cannot get used to this buggy piece of software. I keeps asking me to login every now and then and since last week no mails are downloaded anymore, with a warning 'Yikes, something went wrong'. 
I really like that they try their best, but as far as I can tell from the changelog and website, development has almost completely stopped too. Too bad, I'm not renewing my subscription.
summary: Development stopped? Far from production use - too buggy

description:
App team charges a licensing fee, but doesn't appear to be under active development despite many features being missing and no movement on the project since August 2018.

It does integrate with Exchange and allow basic management of email and calendars, making it functional (I use it every day), but not especially pleasant to use, and minor annoyances add up over time when reminded that they seem like they may never be fixed.
summary: It works, but it's hard to recommend

description: Doesnt work with standard imap servers, very limited

The app itself worked well enough. I even liked some of the features. I did find a minor bug while I was using it. Text formatting was a bit off. Type some bold text, then some normal text. Then sometimes if you unbold text, some text in another paragraph also gets unbolded. Well I'm sorry Hiri but if you want my money you're definitely going to have to get your text formatting straight first!

Aside from the one minor bug, I was definitely annoyed when I finally discovered, only after installing and setting up, that I was in a trial version, and that I would have to pay. Although I do prefer FOSS, I'm not against paying for good software. I am however, completely against paying for software on a subscription basis. Especially when that software is an email app that has many free alternatives. The features Hiri had were nice, but ultimately it is still an email app and not worth the money they were asking for in my opinion.
summary: Worked well for me but I can't afford a subscription

description:
Easy to use. By now I think there are definitely less features as in Outlook.
Exchange integration works fine.

Would recommend, if you are willing to pay a subscription for a mailclient.
summary: Works, is simple, maybe a bit too simple

description:
Downloaded it and I liked the way it worked, so I decided to keep using it at work. I thus bought a one-year license (for $ 30 if I remember correctly).
After a few days I had a simple question about the calendar function, and I wrote an email to customer support. I got a receipt confirmation, but no answer. After 2 weeks I sent a reminder, no answer. After another 3 weeks I sent another reminder, no answer. A month later I sent an angry email, no answer. I think it is close to illegal to run a fake customer support but pretend that you have one, and ask $ 30 for a license...
summary: close to a scam! no support for paying customers

description: I installed Hiri last year, which worked fine then with your IT infrastructure. Unfortunately my IT department told me to stick with Outlook365 in my browser. A few months later I wanted to buy Hiri by myself and installed it again. In the meanwhile our office365 infrastructure changed to MFA with Azure. Hiri doesn't work (at least in our infrasctructure) so I created a support ticket on the 25 of January and got the automatic reply. Since then not one single reply even I wrote again and again, I even wrote the CEO directly. If a company doesn't need to support potential customers, they don't need my and others money.
summary: not working, no support at all

description:
It looked great I bought the support but the development was not there. 
There were many features needed fro my daily work and still missing. 
i have stopped using it.
summary: Good idea with the app but not ready for production

description: Good

Unfortunately I haven't found a better solution. It's functional, relatively stable but lacks ongoing development and functionality. They should open source the application, or start caring about their paying customers.
summary: Works but limited functionality and no updates

description:
Geary AKA Pantheon Mail which is included in Elementary OS is much easier to recommend than this app. 
The reason that's relevant is because Geary isn't particularly stable and reliable, but it's better than this.
Also, with Elementary OS maintaining Pantheon-Mail, you shouldn't have to worry about development dropping.
They charged the visa without permit and did not refund when requested, never responded to complaint either! Thiefs!

Not working!
Not working!
I've been using Hiri for over a year now mostly on Ubuntu laptops. I'm typing this on a laptop with Xubuntu 19.04. This is much easier to set up than Evolution and I personally like the layout.

It fixed a need initially, however, it stopped working after upgrading to 19.04. I contacted support, twice, and they never responded. Last contact was May 6 when they said "Your request (7107) has been received and is being reviewed by our support staff." Today reinstalled using snap; still not working.
summary: No longer working; no support response

description: I was initially happy with Hiri when I signed up about two years ago. When I would post suggestions and bugs I would get a response. However, its crickets when people post ideas on the ideas forum. Its really too bad because it was one product I paid for on Linux because I found it that useful. Its too bad because I really wanted to like it.
summary: Like the product - hate lack of support

description: There is no such thing as a "support staff"! They charge your visa without asking! No development for more than a year now!
I've noticed all my links to hit another domain before going where they need it. That doesn't make me feel good. Besides that I like the software.
summary: I like it but it Tracks LINKs

description: Tried it last year, used for a couple of months as an Exchange client, didn't like it, deleted. The problem is you can't actually unsubscribe, the Support doesn't answer and they still charge me though I don't even use it!
Please add support to Gmail. Your app is really amazing. But it doesn't support most used email service Gmail. I think it's not good idea to leave Gmail aside. Otherwise app UI is really polished.

I bought a lifetime license, because it looks great and they promised new features. But is development seems dead now for over a year.
All together it feels like a scam, also because the their site has a banner with a counter which says "50% off. You'll never see this offer again". And that is not true, the counter start again after it is run out.
not worth a cent

Don't use this mail client, it's buggy as hell, doesn't work well with multi-monitor setups, doesn't render emails anywhere close to correctly, development seems to have stopped, it's got open bug reports for days, just avoid it at all costs. Evolution/Thunderbird is a much better option. Heck even a web client is a much better option than this money spinner.

AVOID
summary: Paid for it, regret it, uninstalled it

description: Too many things - such as Groups - don't work. Twice I filed a help ticket but got zero response from the development team. Updating logins is a major pain. Disappointed, had high hopes for Outlook-like functionality (that's not asking that much!) on my Linux machines. Have removed it - more trouble than it's worth.
summary: Used it for a while, but it's not a professional tool

description: if you add calandar + people it will go beyound
it is just in development phase. it is not ready to market
The site makes it basically impossible to cancel. Had to get my bank to block future charges. Wont' answer emails or phone calls.

It crashes because /etc/os-release is a symlink on pop OS. If you back it up and make it a normal file hiri will work. This works like a third party app integration to exchange and will prompt you to give permissions to the hiri app, including to active directory permissions. Best avoid this one

Decided to try Hiri since I had read some decent reviews and I was looking for a native Linux client for Exchange. Now it does not work, there is no support, development has stopped and it is impossible to cancel the subscription. The only thing that still works is apparently their billing system so they just charged me for a renewal of the annual subscription. Any attempts at contacting their support are met with complete silence. Stay away from this garbage and absolutely never ever give them your credit card number!
summary: This is a scam, avoid at all costs

description: Seems real good so far. Works with outlook365 have calenders, contacts from the company servers aso... Good design.

i bought this for $20 discount, I stopped using it after couple of months because it was buggy & features were merely eye candy to make it look good on screenshots without actual functionality behind it; to my surprise, I was charged $40 after year again, moreover I haven't found a way to unsubscribe, I got no response from developer via email, it's nice they managed to change website's look where they still send this product without actually doing any development on the actual product.. STAY AWAY, DO NOT BUY
It was fine, but nothing special. I can use the Outlook web app at no additional cost, and it works just as well or better.
I tried Hiri and was not impressed. The web of O365 is better. It did not support multiple accounts.
summary: I was better-off using O365 in the browser

description:
Hiri worked for a short while on Ubuntu 19.10 connecting to Office365. And then one day - it stopped working. I just would not authenticate with MFA anymore (it used to work).

What is worst - there is no support from Hiri - even although I paid for it. They simply refuse to answer any support tickets.
summary: Does not work with Office365 and MFA

description: Can not receive email.

Unfortunately there is absolutely no support for the product and almost every annoyance I find and search online for has been being complained about for years.

The interface is beautiful and works quite well, but there are a few things that grate on your nerves. 

Any time you receive an attachment, you have to download it to your system, then open the file manager and go find the file to open it, it won't just download the attachment to a temp folder and open it for you.

You have to allow images from a sender individually, it won't even show the images from other people on my own domain until I allow them. It would be nice if you could just approve by domain instead.

There doesn't appear to be any way to view the header of an email and it even hides the email address of the sender until you click on a down arrow to make it view it.

Spell check in the system has no way to add something to the dictionary. I haven't tested it, but it's possible that you can do it by adding it to the dictionary in another app, like LibreOffice, but that is a long way to go to add a word to the dictionary.

Using the mouse wheel in Hiri is EXTREMELY slow to the point that it is unusable. A full rotation of the wheel will move an email about 5 lines of text. I just end up going over to the scroll bar and dragging it where I need it to go.

Functionally, Hiri is usable, and has so much potential that it is frustrating. It seems like it is basically an abandoned project. Someone somewhere is apparently collecting the money paid for subscriptions and doing absolutely nothing for it. With a bit of love, it could be amazing.
summary: So close to a perfect solution

description: Horrendous software - old, apparently not maintained, support did not answer. Purchased lifetime license immediately to support open source development and then found out it is the worst example - not updated, does not even support IMAP, support never got back to me. I would recommend banning this company from the app store. Nobody should ever use this or make my mistake of giving them money. I really expected Canonical to have some checks in place to prevent this. There have to be minimum standards to be included, at least for commercial software.
summary: Has not been updated in ages, support unresponsive, no IMAP support

description: You're buying a subscription that you can not cancel! Their "support" does not work and you'll have to get a refund through your bank if you fall into their subscription trap.
WARNING: If you buy a subscription, it is non-obvious how to cancel it. I'm still trying to figure out how to cancel the subscription.
summary: Cannot cancel a subscription from the website

description: I subscribed to the service for a year but didn't get enough value to keep it. Impossible to cancel though! There was no contact information on the website, and no response from emails ever received. I ended up needing to dispute the automatic renewal charge with my credit card company.

I purchased this email client and shortly after it went defunct. It is missing many features and is no longer under development. The website is still on and collecting money from clients, with no clue about it being no longer under development. It is dishonest at best, might even be considered a scam.
The app is no longer developed. It should be removed and no longer available for download.
summary: No longer developed, Should be removed

description: Once you give them your credit card details, you cannot unsubscribe. They do not communicate in any way. The essence of product is "good look at first sight, but buggy and featureless for everyday use". The only thing they worked on is their web presentation to get money from newly scammed users, the product is otherwise dead for years without any updates, containing serious bugs affecting even the most elementary functionality. Stay away!
summary: Scam, this should not be in the store

description: I cannot log in into my account (at Hiri's website). I tried to contact support but it seems it doesn't even exist. I still receive automatic payments to my bank account. I had to close my credit card to fix it
summary: They keep on charging me and I just can't quit my subscription

description: Does not work with Gmail, only Exchange mail.
Read a review suggesting this thibg was the bomb. It's rubbish, stick to Evolution, free and ten times better
everything is incredibly good, you only miss dark mode and providing support for gmail and yahoo. if you did at least support them i would have let you my default agent, hope to use it in the future

The app is generally fantastic. Was very impressed by it (other than one or two small issues)
Best modern "Office 365" client on linux.

Developer, however, are not good people. They still actively advertise (& sell) the product, but make no effort to inform you that they had stopped developing the software several years ago. AVOID THE DEVs!
summary: App has great potential, developers run with your money

description: This is a software use to get your money, don't buy it
exchnage doesnt work

Alas, it seems this is no longer in active development. Spoke to my bank to make sure no further payments are taken, they will refund as it's classed as a ponsy scheme if the software is still charging for use but not actively maintained.

This application works so-so, but requires a paid subscription. As long as the application is no longer supported/maintained, you do not have the change your recurring subscription, so your credit card gets charged yearly for nothing, even if you move over to use another client.
summary: No longer Supported, shall be removed from the store

description:
Does not work.
Shows 'hiri' logo then dies.
The app has not been in active development for years. Your credit card will be charged yearly $39 and there is no way to cancel. Just search Hiri scam.

Unfortunately, the app is no longer supported. A bit of a bummer after buying a lifetime licence to it. It seems that there aren't really any desktop alternatives for Linux for Microsoft Exchange email accounts, and this was a nice one. Unfortunately, "was" is the operative word here.
summary: Pretty good when it was supported

description: Then it charged me again the next year.
summary: Ok till I said don't renew in app

description: Good looking app

The emails aren't going out from hiri thru exchange server.
The calender is not seen in the main window.
Snap will not open.
it simpley doesn't open after installation.
The people behind this software is trying to chat you. Stay away from it.
It cost $39 a year and only supports exchange/office 365.
Don't waste your money
The Hiri project has been halted for a few years now. They do not release updates, but continue to charge subscription fees.
Just doesn't open
No gmail support
Doesn't even run or open on Ubuntu
Login zu einem Office365-Firmenaccount schlägt fehl, ebenso in einen privaten Microsoft-Account. Deshalb kann ich leider nicht weiter testen, was das Programm kann.

Hiri kind of words, but I just don't see the added value over using the outlook web client (which actually has more features). You typically use a native mail client like Evolution or Thunderbird to get better system integration, or if you don't care about that, you use the web apps. Hiri is somewhere in between. It is a native application which still feels like a web app. The only use case I can think of is if you want a super simplified used interface and even Outlook web is too much.
runs much to slow
not usable for non-Microsoft accounts - very bad.
summary: only usable with office/outlook email accounts at the moment

description: aaaaa aa aass a
Very good app for my have use on work
summary: Very good app for my have use on work

description: This a bruh moment, i'm finna head out.
Bien pour un seul compte. Impossible de déplacer un mail d'une boîte vers une autre, ce qui n'apporte pas grand chose par rapport au webmail, du coup. Jolie interface.
summary: Pas mal pour un seul compte

description:
Une fois mon courriel paramétrer je n'ai pas été en mesure d'utiliser l'application correctement. La fenêtre du logiciel est plus grande que ma résolution et je n'ai pas pu la réduire (qui n'est pourtant pas si petite) et il n'y a pas de bouton pour l'ajuster automatiquement à la taille de la fenêtre. Pire encore, c'est impossible de la réduire de manière utilisable.

Bref, je n'ai pas réellement utilisé le logiciel, ça me semble déjà en partant une erreur de design importante et je ne jugeais pas pertinent d'aller voir le reste.
>$120 it's abnormal for email client. I've migrated to davmail

Огромная стоимость за практически никакой функционал.

Сортировки писем нет, отложенной отправки нет, настройки прокси нет
дорого, не удобно, зависает

сортировки писем нет, не говорю уже про создание правил обработки входящих писем. При том структуру папок с exchenge качает, и разработчики наверное подразумевает что вы будете вручную по папочкам раскладывать входящие письма. Кнопки поместить письмо в папку нет, но работает перетаскивание мышкой по 1 письму. Пометить все письма как прочитанные тоже нет.

кстати в интернете полно промокода не нее для 15$ за год. 
Но даже с такой ценой не понимаю как сортировать вручную тонны приходящих писем и помечать каждое как прочитанное вручную.

Будьте внимательны, эти гады не продают программу, а подписывают Вас на неё, в итоге с карты списываются деньги без спроса. Техподдержка не отвечает, деньги не возвращают, возможности отменить подписку у них нет
Функционал скромный, перевод не полный, интерфейс скромный, цена завышенная
Платить не за что, кроме дизайна. Функционально не дотягивает даже до стандартного Evolution
Можно было бы просто назвать office360 linux client
summary: наверное хороший клиент если вы пользуетесь почтой Microsoft

description: free software?ssssssssssss

收费的,默认有七天试用期
其他功能做的不错,
